item.title: Deutsche Bank’s Sewing Says Bond Selloff Isn’t Just ‘Flare-Up’
item.description: Deutsche Bank AG Chief Executive Christian Sewing said he expects bond yields to remain elevated in coming months as governments across the world struggle to implement reforms and fiscal discipline.

item.title: Deutsche Bank’s Sewing Says Bond Selloff Isn’t Just ‘Flare-Up’

item.title: Deutsche Bank to Rejoin Euro Stoxx 50 After Seven-Year Absence
item.description: Deutsche Bank AG has regained its spot in the euro area’s main stock benchmark, seven years after being cast out of the gauge.

item.title: Computer-Driven Traders Are Bullish on Stocks, Humans Are Bears
item.description: The thing about trading stocks is everyone has an opinion. And right now there’s an unusual divergence in the market that’s as stark as man versus machine.
